info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 21 at 2:24PM EDT until September 21 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach.
* WHEN...Until 400 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 224 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, Boca Raton, Delray Beach, Margate, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Mission Bay, Godfrey Road, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Boca Pointe, Whisper Walk, Boca Del Mar, Loxahatchee NWR, Hillsboro Pines, Sandalfoot Cove, Hillsboro Ranches, South County Regional Park, Boca West and Ramblewood East. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON
